step1.sentence: Even when the interviewer threw a curveball question, she didn't miss a beat and answered with confidence.

step2.story: The CEO was ambushed by reporters outside the courthouse, firing questions about the leaked financial report. Without missing a beat, she calmly addressed each accusation, turning the hostile confrontation into a press conference on her own terms. Her team watched in awe, reminded why she'd led the company through three crises already.

step3.story: Marcus had been a jazz pianist for twenty years, but tonight's audience was different — a panel of conservatory judges sat in the front row, stone-faced and scribbling notes. Halfway through his improvisation, the bassist snapped a string with a jarring twang that echoed through the hall. The crowd winced, but Marcus didn't miss a beat. He wove the sudden silence of the bass into his melody, transforming the accident into a haunting solo passage. When the piece ended, the judges exchanged glances and began writing furiously. Marcus just smiled — years of playing dive bars and wedding receptions had taught him that the music never stops, even when the instruments do.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 음악에서 박자(beat)를 놓치다(miss)라는 뜻으로, 리듬을 잃는 것을 의미합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 주로 부정형 'not miss a beat'으로 사용되며, 예상치 못한 상황에서도 전혀 당황하지 않고 침착하게 대응하는 것을 뜻합니다. 잠시도 멈추거나 흔들리지 않는다는 뉘앙스입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 음악 용어에서 유래했습니다. 연주 중 박자를 놓치면 전체 리듬이 무너지는데, 이를 일상 상황에 비유하여 '흔들리지 않다'는 의미로 확장되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 대부분 'without missing a beat' 또는 'didn't miss a beat' 형태로 칭찬의 뉘앙스로 쓰입니다. 위기 상황에서의 침착함, 빠른 대처 능력을 강조할 때 자주 사용됩니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: When asked about the scandal, the politician didn't miss a beat and redirected the conversation.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 스캔들에 대한 질문을 받았을 때, 그 정치인은 전혀 당황하지 않고 대화의 방향을 바꿨다.
